answers.answer: I am having the same thing done but until the 27th of this month. The first step I believe. She gave me an orange drink to drink when I go see her. Is that bad if you have it? You are scaring me now.

question: Hi... I'm having a panic party for myself here and needed some help.  I'm currently 25 weeks pregnant and the nurse from my doctors office just called - I flunked step 1 of the glucose screening, so now I have to go back and take step 2 (which is a 3 hour test).  She said my Iron levels were perfect, but that my Sugar was too high.  Of course she told me not to panic and that I could very easily pass step 2.  But if I don't, that means I've developed gestational diabetes.  Considering I took the test the morning after the super bowl, she's hoping that maybe I just ate too many carbs the night before.  So she told me to watch my carbs between now and Tuesday (which is when I'm going to take the 3 hour test).  I called my husband and started crying, I guess because it just scares me.  Even though she told me step 1 didn't necessarily mean anything, it still bothers me.  I really don't eat that many sweets, but apparently it's not the sweets, it's all those potatoes!!  Anyone have any advice?
title: gestational diabetes
